I hate this

Honestly, when it comes to dealing with people with such unresolved trauma, who's very definition of love has been destroyed and molded by an abuser, you really can only keep them at an arm's length. Any closer and their irrational actions will likely hurt you, i.e. Nahomi-chan going out and have sexual relations with older men; as a father, knowing that my daughter, no matter what trauma lead to such actions, would kill me inside because even if I reported the offender to the police, Nahomi-chan would just seek out someone else. Also, you have to be careful that Nahomi-chan's unnatural sexual acts do not lead her to target her father as her next replacement for her 'husband'. Sad all around, really.... Honestly, best thing to do is to talk to her, without shaming her, about her acts on sex and love and try to guide her down a better path.

The mother's reaction had traumatized her just about as much as the events that transpired 3 years prior. The mother, in her mind, seeing Nahomi-chan has the same little girl that she knew before she was kidnapped, raped, and brainwashed for 3 years, and so seeing the result of such events is naturally going to be extremely shocking to her. The problem is how she expressed those desires, as her words can be pretty much interpreted as her not loving the current Nahomi-chan, i.e. Nahomi-chan likely believes her mother no longer loves her anymore. Then you have the father... I feel for him the most, as if I were in his position, I would have to be extremely care and meticulous in what I say to Nahomi-chan to get her on the right path... but then, mental health awareness in Japan is really low compared to in the West. The father keeps his daughter at arm's length because not only is she an entirely different person, as was discovered by the mother, but also to avoid being hurt.
